message_1: Let f(x,y) be a function that takes two integer inputs and returns an integer output. Define g to be the function g(z) = f(z,z+1). If f(3,4) = 7, what is the value of g(3)?
message_2:
Since g(z) = f(z, z+1), we can find the value of g(3) by plugging in 3 for z in the function g:

g(3) = f(3, 3+1)

g(3) = f(3, 4)

We are given that f(3, 4) = 7, so:

g(3) = 7
